metadata.title: CVE-2018-20781 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In pam/gkr-pam-module.c in GNOME Keyring before 3.27.2, the user's passwordis kept in a session-child process spawned from the LightDM daemon. Thiscan expose the credential in cleartext.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20781` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnome-keyring - 3.28.0.2-1ubuntu1.18.04.1
gnome-keyring-pkcs11 - 3.28.0.2-1ubuntu1.18.04.1
libp11-kit-gnome-keyring - 3.28.0.2-1ubuntu1.18.04.1
libpam-gnome-keyring - 3.28.0.2-1ubuntu1.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnome-keyring package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.28.0.2-1ubuntu1.18.04.1').
